title: Ticket #4868: Assertion error in ShadowLog for CMS
description:
We're seeing ASSERTs in the ShadowLog; I think this is related to the error handling code for failures in delegateX509Proxy. 

02/05/15 11:08:55 (118013.14) (26660): Time to redelegate short-lived proxy to starter.
02/05/15 11:09:26 (118013.14) (26660): CCBClient: Failed to read response from CCB server collector 128.142.141.24:9992 when requesting reversed connection to <131.225.189.38:40006>
02/05/15 11:09:26 (118013.14) (26660): CCBClient: received failure message from CCB server collector 128.142.141.17:9992 in response to request for reversed connection to <131.225.189.38:40006>: CCB server rejecting request for ccbid 116562 because no daemon is currently registered with that id (perhaps it recently disconnected).
02/05/15 11:09:26 (118013.14) (26660): Failed to reverse connect to <131.225.189.38:40006> via CCB.
02/05/15 11:09:26 (118013.14) (26660): DCStarter::delegateX509Proxy: Failed to connect to starter <131.225.189.38:40006?CCBID=128.142.141.17:9992#116562%20128.142.141.24:9992#113044&noUDP>
02/05/15 11:09:27 (118013.14) (26660): CCBClient: received failure message from CCB server collector 128.142.141.24:9992 in response to request for reversed connection to <131.225.189.38:40006>: CCB server rejecting request for ccbid 113044 because no daemon is currently registered with that id (perhaps it recently disconnected).
02/05/15 11:09:27 (118013.14) (26660): CCBClient: received failure message from CCB server collector 128.142.141.17:9992 in response to request for reversed connection to <131.225.189.38:40006>: CCB server rejecting request for ccbid 116562 because no daemon is currently registered with that id (perhaps it recently disconnected).
02/05/15 11:09:27 (118013.14) (26660): Failed to reverse connect to <131.225.189.38:40006> via CCB.
02/05/15 11:09:27 (118013.14) (26660): DCStarter::updateX509Proxy: Failed to connect to starter <131.225.189.38:40006?CCBID=128.142.141.17:9992#116562%20128.142.141.24:9992#113044&noUDP>
02/05/15 11:09:27 (118013.14) (26660): condor_write(): Socket closed when trying to write 29 bytes to startd glidein_37453_44612850@cmswn2091.fnal.gov, fd is 7
02/05/15 11:09:27 (118013.14) (26660): Buf::write(): condor_write() failed
02/05/15 11:09:27 (118013.14) (26660): ERROR "Assertion ERROR on (result)" at line 276 in file /slots/03/dir_59220/userdir/src/condor_shadow.V6.1/NTreceivers.cpp

I suspect there's a more appropriate error code to use and not an exception. It's not clear a failure in delegation should kill the shadow.
